gale:repo.gale:text: the [[=http://www.grapple-project.org|GRAPPLE project]] and it's impact on the development of [[../gale|GALE]]

[[=http://www.grapple-project.org|GRAPPLE]] (Generic Responsive Adaptive Personalized Learning Environment) [[../references?tags=DeBra12|[DeBra12~]]] is an EU FP7 STREP project that ran from February 1, 2008 to January 31, 2011. As described in the [[=http://www.grapple-project.org/summary|project summary]], twelve academic and three industrial partners collaborated to develop a generic adaptive learning environment (GALE) and integrate it with (five) different learning management systems (LMS) in order to enable adaptive life-long learning for learners in higher education and industry. We include the architectural overview image here:
{{images/grapple-architecture.jpg|Overview of the GRAPPLE Architecture}}

GRAPPLE designed and built an architecture that consists of: * LMS for managing the learning process, progress and support, * [[../gale|GALE]] for the adaptive delivery of learning material, * [[gumf|GUMF]], a generic User Model Framework that maintains information about each learner as (s)he uses different LMS and GALE instances, * a single sign-on facility (based on [[=http://shibboleth.internet2.edu/|Shibboleth]]) that ensures that all GRAPPLE components recognize the learner through a single identity, * GEB, a generic Event Bus that facilitates asynchronous information exchange between all GRAPPLE components, * [[gat|GAT]], an authoring tool used to create an adaptive course.

As we have seen in the ALS project, AHA! went through some architectural changes to allow the integration with Sakai.In the earlier ALS project, AHA! was already transformed from a single monolithic adaptation engine to a more modularized version that could be integrated in an LMS (Sakai). In GRAPPLE, development on this version of AHA! continued, which eventually lead to [[../gale|GALE]]. Some explanations in the subsections of the GRAPPLE project, especially the section on [[gumf|GUMF]], depend on your knowledge of GALE.
